Change-Id: I29ffcafc8d4d73ac1cb50c94df5da85514d47a3f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE use in ML2 type driver release_segment

SELECT FOR UPDATE expression, which is triggered with the use of the
SQLAlchemy Query object's with_lockmode('update') method, is
detrimental to performance and scalability of the database
performance code in Neutron due to the lock contention it produces.

SELECT FOR UPDATE can be entirely avoided in release_segment methods
with the use of single-shot UPDATE and DELETE expressions, and this
patch clears a number of uses of SELECT FOR UPDATE by consolidating
multiple SQL expressions into one.

Partial-Bug: #1330562
Change-Id: I29ffcafc8d4d73ac1cb50c94df5da85514d47a3f

commit_message:

The change set of be5386ab36acc96c963b39cbce162ebd2b5b841e,
change id of I3f248bb860caafaf38eefcf440d36b9bebc8f05e did incomplete fix.
It replaced thread with treading for python3 portability.
But six.moves._thread is more appropriate and more portable.

Closes-Bug: #1314878

commit_message:
Bump glanceclient to 0.13.1

This version is the first one to be Python3 compatible. Make sure we use it, so
that the Glance client is no longer a blocker for the port of other projects to
Python 3.

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Ibde9be95b29009ebfe1a44e53e46a5fb139bcff8

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception for command 'task detailed'

When an exception occurs in scenario boot_runcommand_delete, the command
'rally task detailed' raise a KeyError exception when trying to display
scenario specific errors.

The fix modify the way scenario specific data are collected and
avoid parsing incorrect data.

Change-Id: Ic345395e028533638c44047de6c05c4d1a06eb1d
Closes-bug: #1336792

Without specifying a nova url in neutron.conf
neutron will attempt to talk to nova on localhost by
default. With the addition of haproxy to tripleO
api services are now proxied using haproxy.  This means
that the default of localhost for nova url is not taking

commit_message:
Add nova url to neutron.conf

Without specifying a nova url in neutron.conf
neutron will attempt to talk to nova on localhost by
default. With the addition of haproxy to tripleO
api services are now proxied using haproxy.  This means
that the default of localhost for nova url is not taking
advantage of the HA endpoint in neutron.conf.
We need to talk to the controller VIP, this change
enables that.

Change-Id: I5eb774e72c101a41cdee887abd19c6628be6df59

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-01 10:49:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix wrong lock name for operating instance external events

This patch correct the wrong lock name for operating instance events.
Currently it use function object InstanceEvents._lock_name as the lock
name, the lock name will be like "<function _lock_name at 0x7fe6a7edec08>".
So when process the server external event, it will use one lock for all
the events that may belong to different instances. This isn't efficient.
This patch correct it to invoke InstanceEvents._lock_name to get the lock
name as '<instance-uuid>-events'. Then the lock is per instance.

Change-Id: I57712afe893933fde6ea7ab3f5d6328f04c65a8a
Closes-Bug: #1330431
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong lock name for operating instance external events

This patch correct the wrong lock name for operating instance events.
Currently it use function object InstanceEvents._lock_name as the lock
name, the lock name will be like "<function _lock_name at 0x7fe6a7edec08>".
So when process the server external event, it will use one lock for all
the events that may belong to different instances. This isn't efficient.
This patch correct it to invoke InstanceEvents._lock_name to get the lock
name as '<instance-uuid>-events'. Then the lock is per instance.

Change-Id: I57712afe893933fde6ea7ab3f5d6328f04c65a8a
Closes-Bug: #1330431

commit_message:
Synced log module and its dependencies from olso-incubator

Old version of 'log' module depended on oslo-incubator RPC layer
implementation. This sync is intended to copy the following fix that
makes log module use oslo.messaging.notify.log_handler if available:

  * 109e325e: Use oslo.messaging to publish log errors

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: Ieb26df4e9fbb2aa4d319c79be7510006fc8461ab

remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the default value.
It's not necessary to set default=None when defining new
parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1323975
Change-Id: Ibd52063cf30ca7b5565b09ed4602c15d5def3645

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6072, 'name': 'Eugene Nikanorov', 'email': 'enikanorov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'enikanorov'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-03 04:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/orchestration/json/orchestration_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/api/orchestration/base.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_swift_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Replaces mutable default parameters with a safe implementation

Using lists or dicts as default parameters is not safe as they
will carry state between method calls. A more safe (and likely
intended) implementation is to set the default value for these
parameters to None, and then set these parameters to an empty
list or dict inside of the method.

Change-Id: Idd5b53e52ad6a24788014236a1d60e070f60782e
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces mutable default parameters with a safe implementation

Using lists or dicts as default parameters is not safe as they
will carry state between method calls. A more safe (and likely
intended) implementation is to set the default value for these
parameters to None, and then set these parameters to an empty
list or dict inside of the method.

Change-Id: Idd5b53e52ad6a24788014236a1d60e070f60782e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-11 10:12:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/compute/v3/servers.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/agents.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/floating_ips.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/volumes.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/keypairs.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/servers.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/images.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/keypairs.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/migrations.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/servers.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/services.py'], 'message': "Correcting 'id' type in compute schema

This patch corrects the type of 'id' in compute schema
/tempest/api_schema/compute/.
Many place 'id' is defined as both 'string' and 'integer' but not all
APIs return 'id' in both format.

For example, servers APIs always return 'server id' as UUID so those
should be defined as 'string' only not {'string', 'integer'} both.
Same applies for other 'id' like in flavor, Image API's response.

Below are the correct type of 'id'-
  Server's id ‚Äì String
  Image id ‚Äì String
  Flavor id - String
  key-pair API- > user_id ‚Äì String
  Agent id ‚Äì Integer
  Service id - Integer

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ifdde2ddd56d600f968d02356aaec0c56e5c3767f
"}]
commit_message:
Correcting 'id' type in compute schema

This patch corrects the type of 'id' in compute schema
/tempest/api_schema/compute/.
Many place 'id' is defined as both 'string' and 'integer' but not all
APIs return 'id' in both format.

For example, servers APIs always return 'server id' as UUID so those
should be defined as 'string' only not {'string', 'integer'} both.
Same applies for other 'id' like in flavor, Image API's response.

Below are the correct type of 'id'-
  Server's id ‚Äì String
  Image id ‚Äì String
  Flavor id - String
  key-pair API- > user_id ‚Äì String
  Agent id ‚Äì Integer
  Service id - Integer

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ifdde2ddd56d600f968d02356aaec0c56e5c3767f

commit_message:
Move the instance_type_id judgment to the except-block

If the instance types are not stashed, will fallback to the
conductor API to retrieve them. So the instance_type_id is
only used in except-block.

Change-Id: If45eb01dd8292e87eda6516cd79c94fb7f6005fb

commit_message:
Remove the skip for test_get_instance_action()

Change Ia1880dd53b7cbf34e66b349f01afb15672dffd12 introduced a skip
for InstanceActionsV3Test.test_get_instance_action(). This was due
to the header x-compute-request-id being changed to
x-openstack-request id. The name has since been updated (as nova
change I5e370fd3de5ee2f8a8d13553015d88910ff5ea87), so the skip
is no longer needed.

Also the skip in change Ia493d4838dee4a8a587d12a55f16afeb143d959d
is no longer needed.

Closes-Bug: 1281915
Change-Id: I4839ba9287f792c8ed352bb63391285a3afc0b84

commit_message:
don't ignore rules that are already enforced

H302 / H304 are clean in the neutron source tree, so it seems
like they shouldn't be ignored. This requires no code changes to
enable.

If there is a longer standing reason for these ignores, would be
great to document in tox.ini.

Change-Id: Ib0f483e4f8fbd328815775a2a6f58be448172bd9

Change-Id: I669e283992347328d602b5a330fde9d1981d22f2

commit_message:
Sync process utils from olso

This change syncs in:

33afb20 Fix broken formatting of processutils.execute log statement
5e3d3a5 Mask passwords included without quotes at the ends of commands
6751b30 Remove extra whitespace

The most important part is '33afb20' which was broken in nova after
the last oslo sync.

Change-Id: I669e283992347328d602b5a330fde9d1981d22f2

commit_message:
cannot add users to groups

Correcting a javascript issue where the modal popup dialog
for adding users to groups was being disposed / detached right away.

The code removed does not seem to be needed or used anywhere.

Change-Id: I299afef6da1c9bc7ab8668f44d08a67219777761
Closes-Bug: 1336560

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-02 00:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Fix OVSBridge.get_port_ofport to handle empty output

Previously ovs_lib.OVSBridge.get_port_ofport() was not handling the
case where db_get_val() was returning None when no output was recieved
from ovs-vsctl.  This patch ensures that the TypeError that results
from this condition is appropriately handled.

Change-Id: I168eb0f2c6f0cb98a3eb3e118972bbaf0383ff89
Partial-bug: #1336172
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OVSBridge.get_port_ofport to handle empty output

Previously ovs_lib.OVSBridge.get_port_ofport() was not handling the
case where db_get_val() was returning None when no output was recieved
from ovs-vsctl.  This patch ensures that the TypeError that results
from this condition is appropriately handled.

Change-Id: I168eb0f2c6f0cb98a3eb3e118972bbaf0383ff89
Partial-bug: #1336172

Add the ability to attach attributes to a column containing a link via

The new link_attributes parameter will eventually replace the less
general link_class attribute.

commit_message:
Adding link_attrs to column.

Add the ability to attach attributes to a column containing a link via
the link_attrs property.

The new link_attributes parameter will eventually replace the less
general link_class attribute.

Co-Authored-By: Davide Guerri <davide.guerri@hp.com>
Change-Id: Iea79aec970a2fe8711a9f5a8b973407df88dcdec
Implements: blueprint add-attribute-links
Closes-Bug: #1298533

commit_message:
Moved rpc_compat.py code back into rpc.py

Most of this code will probably stay with us for quite some time, so
let's make things easier and consider them as our way of doing RPC.

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: Iaf353b23f9c54b82d1e02a6bd5a5960cec827c88

commit_message:
Ensure check and set for volume detach is atomic

Move check_detach logic into begin_detaching and grab lock to
ensure atomic check and set of volume detach.

Change-Id: I0ea8e2665db0883bf8799cf6eec4a0741a0e237d
Closes-Bug: 1238093

commit_message:
Ensure check and set for volume detach is atomic

Move check_detach logic into begin_detaching and grab lock to
ensure atomic check and set of volume detach.

Change-Id: I16daa15f59ac24fab9509caeaf3c54045c116ffa
Closes-Bug: 1238093

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-06-24 08:36:55.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron.conf'], 'message': "Updated neutron.conf to reflect new RPC options

After oslo.messaging port, some option became unavailable to set, some
of them changed description or default values. Make sure we don't leave
anything related to old RPC layer there.

New entries are generated by calling the following from inside
oslo-incubator:

$ python openstack/common/config/generator.py -l oslo.messaging

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: I1523309cf0cd92a5d5f0b265f49979b3e47c2afa
"}]
commit_message:
Updated neutron.conf to reflect new RPC options

After oslo.messaging port, some option became unavailable to set, some
of them changed description or default values. Make sure we don't leave
anything related to old RPC layer there.

New entries are generated by calling the following from inside
oslo-incubator:

$ python openstack/common/config/generator.py -l oslo.messaging

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: I1523309cf0cd92a5d5f0b265f49979b3e47c2afa

commit_message:
The headroom infomation is incomplete

If multiple resources beyond the quotas , the headroom information about
the resources beyond the quotas is incomplete(quota.py).

Change-Id: I9ef6a2c8298424bba1ba4cfb21a7160f16a2d0b8
Closes-Bug: 1334965
